steps.title: Use half-size bra pads if you want a minor, natural boost.
steps.content: Use half-size bra pads if you want a minor, natural boost. If you want to add just a little extra lift and definition but don’t need a full cup size difference, go for bra pads that line the bottom of your bust. They offer a natural appearance while still adding fullness. Typically, these come in 1 size, though you can also find them in sizes small, medium, or large. These are great for formal wear and day-to-day bras. You can also use these in sports bras if you want a little extra coverage. These are not recommended for bathing suits, as they aren't full size. These usually come in round or oblong shapes.

steps.title: Go with bust enhancer pads if you have a smaller or asymmetrical bust.
steps.content: Go with bust enhancer pads if you have a smaller or asymmetrical bust. Shop for pads that are labeled as “bust enhancer pads,” or something similar. Opt for 2 pads if you’d like to make your bust look a little bigger, or use a single pad to even out your bust. [1] X Research source These pads usually provide complete coverage.

steps.title: Select full-size, push-up inserts for added lift and extra cleavage.
steps.content: Select full-size, push-up inserts for added lift and extra cleavage. For voluptuous, sexy looks, consider using push-up pads. These slide into your bra and provide full-coverage lift and definition. You can purchase your push-up inserts based on your bra size. [2] X Research source Push-up inserts go great with nightlife outfits or date night! Full-size inserts are triangular in shape.

steps.title: Choose silicone inserts for maximum lift and bust enhancement.
steps.content: Choose silicone inserts for maximum lift and bust enhancement. Silicone inserts are squishy plastic pads you add to the bottom of your bra for increased shape, lift, and cleavage. Their thick base helps lift your breasts up and forward for the ultimate addition to your bra. Typically, these come in 1 uniform size. [3] X Research source They can add up to a cup size! Silicone inserts come in round or half-moon shapes. They are usually transparent.

steps.title: Use the padding from an old bathing suit or bra for a free option.
steps.content: Use the padding from an old bathing suit or bra for a free option. Instead of purchasing inserts, you can use the ones you already own. Most bathing suit tops have removable pads secured by a small flap of fabric. Some sports bras also come with removable padding. To remove your inserts, separate both layers of fabric from the bra or bathing suit, and pull out the insert. [4] X Research source You can always put it back in your swimsuit or bra later.

steps.title: Put on your bra
steps.content: Put on your bra . Fasten the band of your bra to a comfortable size, and slip your straps over your shoulders. [5] X Research source You will add your inserts to your bra after it is on your body.

steps.title: Slip the inserts into both cups of your bra so they sit at the bottom.
steps.content: Slip the inserts into both cups of your bra so they sit at the bottom. Pull the cup of your bra forward, and place an insert inside. Then, do this for the other cup. The thickest part of the insert should be at the bottom of your breast. [6] X Research source Adjust it into place so it fits comfortably on top of the bottom band of your bra. The insert will sit between your bra and your skin. If you don't want your insert to shift around, try holding it in place with double-stick fashion place. You can also double-up with a safety pin or even sew them into place, if you'd like. [7] X Research source Katie Quinn. Stylist. Personal interview. 8 May 2020.

steps.title: Put on a shirt to check the insert placement and adjust them if needed.
steps.content: Put on a shirt to check the insert placement and adjust them if needed. After your inserts are situated, get dressed and check yourself out in the mirror. Look at the sides and shape of your breasts, and adjust your inserts if you need to. If one side looks fuller than the other, adjust the inserts so both sit completely under your bust. These should stay in place all day. but you should double-check throughout the day just in case. [8] X Research source Check out how great you look!

steps.title: Locate the opening of your bathing suit top.
steps.content: Locate the opening of your bathing suit top. For most bathing suits, the opening begins along your bust line, usually placed at the outer corner of your top towards your arms. Lay your bathing suit top on a flat surface, and run your fingers along the bust line to locate the opening. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Cut a slit into the lining if your top doesn’t have an existing opening.
steps.content: Cut a slit into the lining if your top doesn’t have an existing opening. If your bathing suit does not have an opening, that’s okay! Grab a pair of scissors, and cut a slit about 1–2 inches (2.5–5.1 cm) wide in the lining of your suit along your bust line. Make sure you only cut the lining of your top, not the actual bathing suit itself. [10] X Research source To cut discreet holes, you can make your cuts on the corner closest to your underarm. Cut them along the bottom band of your bathing suit top.

steps.title: Stick your insert inside the opening in your bathing suit top.
steps.content: Stick your insert inside the opening in your bathing suit top. You can lightly squeeze the sides of the inserts, and push them into the opening or the slit you cut. Your inserts will stay in place because they are larger than the size of your slits. [11] X Research source If using full-size inserts, fold them in half before you insert them and let them unfold into full shape when they are inside.

steps.title: Adjust your inserts as needed so they lie flat in your top.
steps.content: Adjust your inserts as needed so they lie flat in your top. Use your fingers to slide around the insert so it is flush with your bathing suit top. If you have full-size inserts, position the triangle shape so it aligns correctly with the shape of your top. If using half-size inserts, they should line the bottom of your bathing suit.

steps.title: Sew your inserts into place if you’d like.
steps.content: Sew your inserts into place if you’d like. After you slip the inserts into the liner, thread a sewing needle so you can stitch up the hole you cut. Pierce your needle through the lining at the edge of your slit, and pull your needle through to the other side of the lining. This is how you can make your stitches . Then, bring your needle back through the top to repair the small hole you cut. Make your stitches starting at the beginning of the slit, and tie a knot at the end of your thread when you reach the end. While this is not required, it will help keep your insert securely in your top. This applies for both bathing suits that have openings and those that you cut yourself.

steps.title: Wash your inserts after each use.
steps.content: Wash your inserts after each use. To keep your inserts clean, it is best to wash them after each time you wear them. [12] X Research source Cotton or polyester inserts can be washed with your other clothing, but silicone inserts must be hand washed.

steps.title: Launder your cloth inserts with your other clothes.
steps.content: Launder your cloth inserts with your other clothes. Bra pads made of cotton or polyester can easily go into your wash. Rinse your clothes on a gentle cycle with mild detergent, and you can wash them with similar colors. [13] X Research source You can throw them into a lingerie bag and wash them with your bras if you’d like. If you put your inserts inside your bathing suit, you can wash the top with the inserts inside.

steps.title: Clean your silicone inserts with a washcloth, soap, and water.
steps.content: Clean your silicone inserts with a washcloth, soap, and water. When you are ready to wash your silicone inserts, hold your inserts under running warm water. Apply hand or dish soap to a washcloth, and clean the cups in a circular motion. Rinse off any remaining soap and water. [14] X Research source Use a dime-sized amount of soap to wash your inserts. This should be plenty to use for both of them.

steps.title: Let your inserts air dry.
steps.content: Let your inserts air dry. Rather than machine drying your inserts, leave both your cloth and silicone inserts out to dry. If the inserts are folded or shaped oddly after the wash, you can reshape them with your hands before you lay them to dry. Silicone inserts will dry in about 30 minutes, and you can use a towel to pat them dry. Cloth inserts will dry in 2-4 hours. [15] X Research source You can clip your inserts to a drying rack or leave them lying on a flat surface.
